philosophy.title: Human warmth as the only compass in the dark.
philosophy.p1: Imagine two explorers crossing paths in the middle of nowhere. They don't ask "how much did you pay to be here?", but "what is your story?".
philosophy.p2: <1>MeetMeThere</1> is this digital campfire. A circle of light where we drop our masks, where we share a meal, music, a silence.
philosophy.p3: Here, the currency is not the Euro, but the Attention we give to others.

manifest.title: The Manifesto of the Sovereign Club
manifest.subtitle: Humanity as the ultimate destination.
manifest.s1_title: The Paradox of Our Time: The Epidemic of Loneliness
manifest.s1_p1: We are living the silent tragedy of modernity: never have we been so technologically connected, yet never have we been so profoundly isolated. The World Health Organization now classifies this epidemic of loneliness as a major public health risk, comparable to the ravages of smoking.
manifest.s1_p2: Millions of people report feeling socially isolated. The networks that promised to bring us closer have only erected new barriers, transforming the Other into a simple revenue stream or a measurable commodity.
manifest.s2_p1: Faced with this isolation, travel should have remained our remedy, our bridge to the unknown. But modern travel has become sterilized to the point of complete erasure of connection. The industrialization of tourism has replaced hospitality with cold, transactional logistics.
manifest.s2_p2: Between standardized hotel chains with interchangeable corridors and seasonal rentals managed by automated concierges equipped with anonymous lockboxes, the original purpose of travel has disappeared. We have imposed the toxic software of commercial accounting on travel: we count nights like commodities, we calculate yield by the hour. This logic has killed spontaneity, creating an economic divide where escape becomes an inaccessible luxury for clearly the majority, and where the guest is nothing more than a client to be billed.
manifest.s3_title: Our Response: An Operating System for Kindness
manifest.s3_p1: <0>MeetMeThere OS</0> is not just another booking app. It is a radical philosophical and technological response to a world that is isolating itself. We are building the operating system for a new Nation of Hospitality.
manifest.s3_p2: We believe that technology should not be a wall, but a "facilitator of courage." It must act as an invisible and infallible shield that guarantees total security (via our zero-impunity protocol) and absolute trust, allowing everyone to dare, once again, to cross the threshold of a stranger's door.
manifest.s4_title: The New Paradigm: Hospitality as an Engine of Freedom
manifest.s4_p1: In this sovereign ecosystem, we abolish the coldness of financial transactions to embrace the economy of Vitality. Welcoming becomes the fuel for one's own freedom of movement.
manifest.s4_li1: <0>The end of the "Traveller-Consumer":</0> Make way for the "Citizen-Contributor". Experience can no longer be bought; it is earned through commitment, reciprocity, and generosity.
manifest.s4_li2: <0>The home as a port of embarkation:</0> Even when immobile, the act of welcoming transmutes a simple dwelling (a Node) into a window on the world. By travelling vicariously, the member lets the stories of their guests redraw the walls of their living room, while accumulating social energy (Vitality) for their own future escapes.
manifest.s4_li3: <0>Adventure rather than the overnight stay:</0> We reject the accounting logic of the hotel night. Every exchange, every shared project, every orchestrated meal is an "Adventure": an indivisible unit of experience whose value depends on the intensity of the human connection, not on the passing of time.
manifest.s5_title: The Oath of the Sovereign Citizen
manifest.s5_p1: Joining MeetMeThere is not downloading a service; it's subscribing to a worldview. It is the return of true hospitality, where technology fades away to leave all room for the unexpectedness of reality and the magic of controlled chance.
manifest.s5_p2: Here, every exchange, every complicit silence shared, or every improvised collaboration around a table is a final destination in itself. Humanity, freed from the dross of commodification, remains our most beautiful and vastest territory to explore.
manifest.quote: I am not here to consume the space of the other, but to enrich their time. My door is someone else's passport, their home is my destination. The greatest adventure is, and will always remain, the one that leads us boldly towards the Other.

cgv.title: Terms and Conditions of Sale
cgv.a1_p: These Terms and Conditions of Sale (TCS) govern all relations between MeetMeThere (hereinafter "the Platform") and its users (hereinafter "the Members"). Any registration on the Platform implies full and complete acceptance of these TCS.
cgv.a2_p: MeetMeThere is a community-based platform connecting travelers and hosts, founded on a non-monetary exchange system based on "Hearts". The Platform facilitates authentic human encounters through shared hospitality.
cgv.a3_p: Access to the Platform's services requires prior registration and payment of an annual subscription fee, the amount of which varies according to the membership tier:
cgv.a4_p: The Heart system is the internal unit of exchange on the Platform. A Heart is earned when a Member hosts a traveler, and spent when they stay with another Member. The Half-Heart (½) applies to lighter services (parking space, couch). Hearts are neither refundable nor convertible into currency.
cgv.a5_p: Each Member commits to providing accurate information upon registration. The Platform reserves the right to carry out identity verification and to refuse or revoke any registration that does not meet its trust criteria.
cgv.a6_p: MeetMeThere acts as a technical intermediary. The Platform cannot be held responsible for the relationships between Members, accommodation conditions, or any direct or indirect damages resulting from the use of the service.
cgv.a7_p: In accordance with Article L221-18 of the French Consumer Code, any Member has a period of 14 days from the date of subscription to exercise their right of withdrawal, without having to provide any reason.
cgv.a8_p: MeetMeThere is committed to protecting the personal data of its Members in compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The collected data is necessary for the functioning of the service and is never passed on to third parties.
cgv.a9_p: These TCS are governed by French law. Any dispute relating to their interpretation or execution is under the exclusive jurisdiction of the French courts.
